indicator_available: Number of confirmed cases of dengue fever, chikungunya and rabies
national_indicator_description: Number of confirmed cases of dengue fever and chikungunya in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, and the number of confirmed cases of rabies in the United Kingdom.
goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals metadata for target 3.3
computation_calculations: No calculations were performed as the data is readily available from the sources.
data_footnote: 1. Headline figures include number of reported cases of Dengue Fever and Chikungunya for England, Wales and Northern Ireland only. 2. Timescales and geographical coverage are not consistent across graphs.

graph_titles.title: Confirmed cases of Chikungunya and Dengue fever
Confirmed cases of rabies in humans

source_url_text_1: Laboratory-confirmed cases of chikungunya by region of travel, England, Wales and Northern Ireland - 2009 to 2014
source_next_release_1: TBC: We plan to update indicator data within 4 months of data being released
source_other_info_1: Data provided by the Rare and Imported Pathogens Laboratory, PHE Centre for Emergency Preparedness and Reponse, Porton Down. Note that the totals in the table are higher than the total number of cases stated in the report as some cases travelled to more than one country. All possible travel destinations are included for analysis if no dates of travel or onset have been stated; in reality a case is likely to have acquired his/her infection in only one country.
source_url_text_2: Confirmed cases of dengue fever by region of travel, England, Wales and Northern Ireland - 2009 to 2014
source_next_release_2: TBC: We plan to update indicator data within 4 months of data being released
source_other_info_2: Data provided by the Rare and Imported Pathogens Laboratory, PHE Porton and collated by the Travel and Migrant Health Section.
source_next_release_3: TBC: We plan to update indicator data within 4 months of data being released
source_other_info_3: Taken from 'Human rabies in the UK' section
other_info:
Please note, rabies data is only updated on the source when a new case is identified.

Data follows the UN specification for this indicator. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
page_content: Please note - The majority of cases of Neglected Tropical Diseases (NTD's) in the United Kingdom are imported cases from outside of the United Kingdom, and caution needs to be applied when interpreting the data. There are a number of factors that play a role in influencing infection, and treatment usually occurs in the United Kingdom and not the country of origin. More information on neglected tropical diseases in the United Kingdom can be seen in the following guidance pages - [Dengue fever](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/dengue-fever-guidance-data-and-analysis), [Chikungunya](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/chikungunya), [Rabies](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/rabies-epidemiology-transmission-and-prevention).
